intro: Albuca cornuta, commonly known as the horned albuca, is a bulbous plant native to southern Africa. It features striking, spiky, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in spring. The plant has a fibrous root system and produces small, oval-shaped bulbs that store nutrients. Its leaves are typically narrow and grass-like, with a slightly hairy texture. Albuca cornuta is adapted to arid environments and requires well-drained soil to thrive.
